meanings.definition: Distinguish between two or more things
meanings.sent1: I can differentiate between the red and blue cars.
meanings.sent2: It is important to differentiate between right and wrong.
meanings.sent3: The detective was able to differentiate the real painting from the fake.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eye could differentiate even the subtlest of differences.
meanings.sent5: To succeed in the test, you must be able to differentiate the correct answers.

meanings.definition: Make someone or something appear different or distinct
meanings.sent1: Using different colors can help differentiate the sections of the report.
meanings.sent2: The new logo design aims to differentiate the brand from its competitors.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to differentiate the two identical coins.
meanings.sent4: The unique packaging design helps differentiate the product on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: To stand out in the crowd, you need to differentiate yourself from others.

meanings.definition: Develop in a specialized way from a general form
meanings.sent1: Cells differentiate to form various tissues in the body.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the caterpillar will differentiate into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The software program can differentiate into different versions for specific needs.
meanings.sent4: Each student will differentiate their project based on personal interests.
meanings.sent5: In nature, plants differentiate to adapt to different environments.
